alert.note: Alert for Alamance (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR ALAMANCE...NORTHWESTERN MOORE...ORANGE...NORTHERN LEE AND CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 648 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mebane to near Goldston, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Chapel Hill, Burlington, Sanford, Graham, Hillsborough, Pittsboro, Siler City, Carrboro, Mebane and Goldston. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
